content.description: To the left of Dragonfly. Starts left of the large bush, up the face into a bit of a gulley, follows the namesake arch up then returns to face climbing. Few options, build gear anchor above arch, traverse right to dragonfly anchor, or continue straight up to ledge and build anchor to bring up follower and walk off.
content.protection: Standard rack-some larger pieces, gear anchor or traverse right to dragonfly bolts.
content.location: Slab section between two large bush’s, left of dragonfly. Look for the arch and black streak.

climbs.name: Dragonfly
climbs.fa: Mark Schlocker / Renee Sisneros / Dan Braihland

content.description:
Slab climbing straight up the middle of the Woodson View slabs.  Most of it is pretty mellow but there are a few spicy moves thrown into the mix.  A nice warm up.

The FA was quite challenging due to exfoliating rock that has mostly been cleaned off.
content.protection: 8 bolts to a rap station.  All bolts were put in on lead.  FA went to top but it's advised to rap at the station 90 feet off the deck.

content.description: I cleaned and toproped most of a line just right of Dragonfly.  Using the bolts on Dragonfly  so it needs it's own anchor.  Or bolt the whole thing as a lead if you want to.  Similar but easier than Dragonfly.

A thin and flared seam leads up low angle climbing.  The start requires traversing in past the namesake bush on a slab to the seam.  Follow the seam up.  Eventually the seam thins and arches left, follow this until it touches off on a hand crack.  Pro the hand crack and traverse right to the last lead bolt of Dragonfly.  Clip this and continue to the Dragonfly anchor.
content.protection: Not protected for the first 15 feet, which may be the crux.  The seam takes small nuts surprisingly well.  Thumb sized cams are useful, gear up to #1 Camalot.  Slings for the traverse.  Probably not a route to be breaking into the grade on.
content.location: Left of Dragonfly about 20 feet.  Traverse in from the right, past a "dirty" bush blocking the base of the route.
